paper_abstract: Through task decomposition and module combination, min-max modular support vector machines (M-3-SVMs) can be successfully used for different pattern classification tasks. Based on an equal clustering algorithm, M-3-SVMS can divide the training data set of the original problem into several subsets with nearly equal number of samples, and combine them to a series of balanced subproblems which can be trained more efficiently and effectively. In this paper, we explore the use of M-3-SVMs with equal clustering method in gender recognition. The experimental results show that M-3-SVMS with equal clustering method can be successfully used for gender recognition and make the classification more efficient and accurate.
paper_title: Gender recognition using a min-max modular support vector machine with equal clustering
